author: Tony M. Centeno
title: Lil Baby Brings Out Quavo, J. Cole & More During Sold-Out Birthday Concert
text:
Photo: Getty Images
Lil Baby brought a group of his famous friends out to perform with him in honor of his birthday.
On Wednesday night, December 27, the Georgia native hosted his sold-out "Lil Baby & Friends" concert at the State Farm Arena in Atlanta. During the show, fans saw Baby reunite with Quavo and pay homage to the late TakeOff . Quavo performed their Only Built For Infinity Links hit "Hotel Lobby" as well as his stand-out collaboration with Future "Turn Yo Clic Up." J. Cole also pulled up to the show and performed his hits "Middle Child" and "No Role Modelz."
Those weren't the only guests who made headlines for their surprise sets. Yung Miami also popped up at the concert to perform her verse off Lola Brooke's "Don't Play With It" (Remix). She had everyone going crazy after fans thought she tried to shoot her shot at Baby while on stage.
‚ÄúIf I throw it back can you catch it?‚Äù Caresha asked Baby.
Baby also invited other major acts like 2 Chainz , Lil Durk , Gloss Up , 21 Savage , Veeze , Saucy Santana , Hunxho , Fridayy , YTB Fatt , Rob49 , 42 Dugg , Jacquees and more to join him during the concert. His all-star show went down just months after Baby wrapped up his "It's Only Us Tour" following the release of his previous LP It's Only Me .
Check out more moments from Lil Baby's birthday concert below.

author: Eli Burgett
title: chevron-right
text: MONTGOMERY COUNTY, Ohio (WKEF) ‚Äì Law enforcement agencies all over Montgomery County are promoting traffic safety. They are primarily cracking down on those who drive under the influence. The Montgomery County Sheriff's Office is working with Ohio State Patrol and police departments from several cities to reduce traffic-related crimes. They are doing this by implementing sobriety checkpoints, establishing a joint traffic enforcement detail, and displaying how they are taking part in ‚ÄúThe National Drive Sober Or Get Pulled Over Campaign.‚Äù ‚ÄúWe don‚Äôt want to have to go knock on that door and tell somebody that their family member is not coming home because of an impaired driver,‚Äù said Captain Andy Flagg of the Montgomery County Sheriff‚Äôs Office. ‚ÄúYou know, it happens quite often, more often than any of us would like, in Montgomery County, in the state of Ohio, and across the nation.‚Äù On August 16th, the Montgomery County Sheriff's Office, as well as many other agencies, will begin taking part in ‚ÄúThe National Drive Sober Or Get Pulled Over Campaign.‚Äù In 2023, there were 512 OVI related crashes in Montgomery County with 43 of them resulting in death. Law enforcement is aiming to reduce these numbers for 2024 by raising awareness, educating the public, and setting up sobriety checkpoints at several places throughout the county. Flagg continued, ‚ÄúWhen you take somebody that likes to drive fast, or without turn signals, or other little things, and you add impairment into that, it kind of emphasizes those problems. You come out with far more severe results.‚Äù As well as reinforcing sober driving, the agencies in Montgomery County formed a joint traffic enforcement detail along Interstate 75 and State Route 48. This detail will involve the County Sheriff‚Äôs Office, Ohio State Patrol, and police departments from Dayton, Vandalia, Moraine, and many other cities. With this detail, their goal is to reduce traffic related crimes in these areas and promote collaboration between departments to ensure that all county roads are safer. ‚ÄúFor the purpose of collaborating and filling the roles that need to be filled in these particular campaigns, we‚Äôre trying to make sure that we are making a safe county,‚Äù Flagg added. The National Drive Sober Or Get Pulled Over Campaign‚Äù begins on August 16th, and will run all the way through September 2nd.

author: Pastor Batista Vald√©s
title: En buen estado de salud piloto de avioneta accidentada
text: Al cierre de esta edici√≥n, Armando Leyva Sosa, piloto de la avioneta modelo M-18 accidentada este jueves 20 de junio, mientras realizaba labores de fumigaci√≥n en √°reas arroceras de La Sierpe, provincia de Sancti Spiritus, contin√∫a cumpliendo normalmente el protocolo de seguimiento y vigilancia establecido, en la sala de observaciones del Hospital Camilo Cienfuegos, de la cabecera provincial, sin que hasta ese momento se reportaran resultados o s√≠ntomas de alteraci√≥n en los ex√°menes realizados. De acuerdo con la valoraci√≥n del doctor Alex√°nder Concepci√≥n, jefe de la guardia de cirug√≠a, ‚Äúel paciente se encuentra estable, bien, sin cambios en la tensi√≥n arterial, frecuencia card√≠aca, respiraci√≥n o temperatura‚Ä¶‚Äù Radiograf√≠as de t√≥rax, ultrasonidos abdominales y otros ex√°menes de rutina han confirmado la no existencia de lesiones pluripulmonares, en √≥rganos internos o de otra √≠ndole, como consecuencia del accidente que precipit√≥ el aparato a tierra, seg√∫n explica la joven Marian Laura D√≠az, enfermera de la sala. En muy breve conversaci√≥n con Granma, Leyva Sosa agradeci√≥ la sensible atenci√≥n recibida, primero por especialistas del policl√≠nico ubicado en La Sierpe y luego de su traslado hacia el hospital provincial, as√≠ como las numerosas llamadas que ha recibido por parte de familiares, amigos y compa√±eros de trabajo, interesados en conocer acerca de la evoluci√≥n y estado de salud. Como expres√≥ en su perfil de Facebook Eduardo Rodr√≠guez D√°vila, ministro cubano de Transporte, la avioneta pertenece a la Empresa Nacional de Servicios A√©reos (ENSA) y una comisi√≥n del Instituto de Aeron√°utica Civil de Cuba investiga las causas del suceso.

author: Tim Huber
title: Benchmade Modernizes Its First-Ever AXIS Lock Knife For Its 25th Anniversary
text:
In 1999, Benchmade shook up the pocket knife space with the debut of its first-ever AXIS lock-equipped model with the 710. And with 25 years having passed since the 710‚Äôs debut, the
Oregon City outfit has opted to mark the occasion via a special run of modernized, re-mastered 710 knives crafted from a super premium material selection.
Though it largely stays true to the original 710 design from two-and-a-half-decades-ago, the new Seven | Ten lineup jettisons the original knife‚Äôs D2 and G10 constructions in favor of more contemporary ‚Äî and markedly more top-shelf ‚Äî machined aerospace-grade anodized 6061-T6 aluminum scales and a 4-inch recurve drop point blade offered in CPM MagnaCut or CPM S90V. Spanning 8.95‚Äù overall, both the MagnaCut and S90V versions also see the original 710‚Äôs FRN backspace replaced with a knurled aluminum item. Made in America and backed by a lifetime warranty, both aluminum handle Seven | Ten models also benefit from a redesigned take on
Benchmade‚Äôs signature AXIS lock.
While there‚Äôs no denying how special these two aforementioned Seven | Ten releases are, Benchmade has nonetheless opted to give its most discerning customers the option to acquire an even rarer, and more elite 710 tribute. This ultra-top-shelf version is legitimately made from some of the finest materials currently available to the knife making world. For starters, its handle is crafted from 6AL-4V titanium and features a black DLC-coating and a super ornate backspacer design ‚Äî along with the same redesigned AXIS lock present on the MagnaCut and S90V versions. Rather than using a CPM metal, the titanium-scaled Seven | Ten gets a super-premium Fafnir-pattern Damascus steel blade courtesy of Sweden‚Äôs Damasteel. This beautiful layered blade is also deployed via a specially-machined set of thumb-studs that, like the backspacer, sport a unique and ornate design.
The Benchmade Seven | Ten knife lineup is available for order now, with pricing starting at $600 for the aluminum and MagnaCut version, and going up to $1,500 for the titanium and Damascus variant.

author: archyde
title: Putin announces revision of ‚Äònuclear weapons use principles‚Äô
text:
image copyrightReuters
Photo caption, Russian President Vladimir Putin has already threatened the possibility of using nuclear weapons in the past, but this scenario is expected to become more concrete with the proposal to revise the nuclear doctrine document. Article related information
Russian President Vladimir Putin announced on the 25th (local time) that he is considering revising the nuclear doctrine document, which contains the principles of nuclear use.
It included the content that if a non-nuclear-weapon state carries out a ‚Äújoint attack‚Äù on Russia with the support of a nuclear-weapon state, the supporting state will also be considered an aggressor. This part is interpreted as a threat that nuclear weapons may be used in the war in Ukraine.
President Putin announced on the night of the 25th after the National Security Council that the Russian government is considering revising the rules and preconditions for using nuclear weapons.
Ukraine is a non-nuclear state that receives military support from other nuclear weapons states, including the United States.
President Putin‚Äôs remarks came as Ukraine asked the West for permission to use long-range missiles it supported to target Russian military facilities.
Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy headed to the United States this week and is scheduled to meet President Joe Biden in Washington on the 26th (local time), so this request is expected to be top of the agenda.
Ukraine has pushed into mainland Russia this year and wants to fire missiles at military bases in Russia that it claims are where the missiles are launched.
Meanwhile, Ukrainian President‚Äôs Chief of Staff Andriy Yermak responded to President Putin‚Äôs remarks by saying, ‚ÄúThere is nothing in Russia that can threaten the world other than the nuclear threat.‚Äù
In fact, President Putin has previously threatened to use nuclear weapons. At the time, Ukraine criticized it as a ‚Äúnuclear blackmail‚Äù aimed at preventing further support from Western allies.
China, Russia‚Äôs ally, also urged restraint, with reports that President Xi Jinping warned President Putin against using nuclear weapons.
However, after the National Security Council meeting on the 25th, President Putin announced a radical revision plan.
The revised nuclear doctrine ‚Äúclearly contains the conditions under which Russia could transition to the use of nuclear weapons,‚Äù and was followed by a warning that a conventional missile attack against Russia would also be included as a condition for the use of nuclear weapons.
Putin said Russia would consider the ‚Äúpossibility‚Äù of using nuclear weapons if it senses a ‚Äúgrave threat‚Äù to national sovereignty due to large-scale launches of missiles, aircraft and drones into its territory.
He added, ‚ÄúEven if the subject of the attack on Russia was a non-nuclear state, any country participating or receiving support from a nuclear state would regard it as a joint attack by them.‚Äù
President Putin claims that nuclear weapons are ‚Äúthe most important and certain promise that guarantees the safety of the Russian state and people.‚Äù
After the end of World War II, nuclear-armed states engaged in a policy of nuclear deterrence, believing that a preemptive large-scale nuclear attack by a warring state could lead to mutually assured destruction.
However, there are also tactical nuclear weapons, which are small warheads designed to destroy limited targets without extensive radioactive fallout (radioactive material that spreads and remains in the surrounding area during a nuclear explosion).
Last June, President Putin told European countries supporting Ukraine, ‚ÄúEven if the United States brings its own tactical nuclear weapons, Russia has far more (tactical nuclear weapons) than the entire European continent has.‚Äù sent a warning to
At the time, President Putin said, ‚ÄúEurope does not have an up-to-date (early warning system),‚Äù and criticized, ‚ÄúIn this sense, they are almost defenseless.‚Äù
At that time, President Putin already hinted that he might revise the nuclear doctrine document, which contains the conditions under which Russia can use nuclear weapons.

author: Elena Vi√±as
title: Los trabajadores del Ayuntamiento de Pasaia se movilizan para recuperar su poder adquisitivo
text:
Secciones

Destacamos
Pasaia
Necesitas ser suscriptor para acceder a esta funcionalidad.
Viernes, 29 de noviembre 2024, 16:12
Necesitas ser suscriptor para acceder a esta funcionalidad.
Tras explicar y debatir en asamblea de trabajadores los pormenores del proceso de recuperaci√≥n del poder adquisitivo, la Junta de Personal del Ayuntamiento de Pasaia ha decidido retomar las movilizaciones que estaban suspendidas desde el pasado mes de junio. El motivo es, entre otros, la falta de acuerdo con el equipo de Gobierno municipal para recuperar el poder adquisitivo en 2024.
As√≠ lo informan a trav√©s de una nota de prensa. En ella, explican que desde 2010 el poder adquisitivo de los trabajadores ha disminuido en un 16%, y en el caso de los trabajadores del Ayuntamiento de Pasaia, esta p√©rdida de poder adquisitivo es m√°s acusada debido a que los salarios de esta localidad son actualmente inferiores a los salarios de los trabajadores de otros ayuntamientos de la comarca de Oarsoaldea. Por ello, la primera concentraci√≥n ha tenido lugar este viernes, a las 12.00 horas, frente al Palacio Arizabalo. Se han agrupado 50 trabajadores.
La Junta de Personal ha anunciado su intenci√≥n de continuar con las movilizaciones en las pr√≥ximas semanas y ya ha realizado un llamamiento para la pr√≥xima, que tendr√° lugar el 5 de diciembre, a las 10.00 horas, a las puertas del consistorio de Pasaia.

author: Alvar Salvador
title: Una gran alarma social: as√≠ robaron en 28 templos sagrados de la provincia de Le√≥n el dinero de los cepillos
text: Hay dos personas detenidas por los hechos25 mayo, 2024 11:25 La Guardia Civil ha detenido a dos personas dentro de la Operaci√≥n Sayos. Se trata de una mujer y un hombre, supuestos autores de los delitos de robo con fuerza que se han producido desde el pasado mes de mayo de 2023 en un total de 28 iglesias y ermitas ubicadas en la provincia de Le√≥n. La operaci√≥n comenz√≥ a finales del 2023, tras detectar los investigadores la comisi√≥n de varios delitos de id√©ntica naturaleza. Robos con fuerza en el interior de los templos religiosos con el mismo modus operandi. En todos los casos sustra√≠an el dinero de cepillos y lampadarios, los cuales previamente hab√≠an forzado, sin llevarse otros objetos de valor que se encontraban dentro de los templos. A la vista de los hechos, los cuales hab√≠an generado gran alarma social entre los vecinos de las localidades afectadas y, tras la pr√°ctica de numerosas diligencias de investigaci√≥n y otras pesquisas, por los agentes encargados de la investigaci√≥n pudo determinarse que los detenidos se val√≠an del empleo de la fuerza para violentar, tanto las puertas de acceso a los templos, como los cepillos y/o lampadarios que se encontraban en los mismos para, posteriormente sustraer el dinero en efectivo que hallaban en su interior. Adem√°s, todos los hechos fueron cometidos en el interior de iglesias ubicadas en peque√±as localidades y en horas ‚Äìgeneralmente por las noches‚Äì en las que los supuestos autores se aseguraban una baja afluencia de personas para as√≠ evitar ser descubiertos. Alta movilidad geogr√°fica Si bien todos los robos se circunscriben al √°mbito geogr√°fico de la provincia de Le√≥n, los detenidos llegaron a recorrer cientos de kil√≥metros en una sola noche para cometer los robos en distintas localidades, no descart√°ndose su participaci√≥n en hechos de similar naturaleza en iglesias ubicadas en otras provincias lim√≠trofes. Los detenidos se hab√≠an especializado en la comisi√≥n de este tipo de robos, a los cuales les figura un amplio historial delictivo en los registros policiales. Con las detenciones practicadas se dan por esclarecidos los robos en 28 templos religiosos acontecidos durante los √∫ltimos a√±os en la provincia de Le√≥n, concretamente en las localidades de Castrotierra de la Valduerna, Brimeda, Destriana, Pobladura de Yuso, Ransinde, Villiba√±e, Moz√≥ndiga (2), Chozas de Arriba (2), Pozuelo del P√°ramo, Moral de Orbigo, Villar√≠n del P√°ramo, Cazanuecos (2), La Antigua, Torneros del Bernesga, Val de San Rom√°n, Altobar de la Encomienda (2), Navianos de la Vega, La Nora del R√≠o, Quintana del Marco, Genestacio de la Vega (2), Moscas del P√°ramo (3). Las actuaciones han sido llevadas a cabo por componentes del √Årea de Delincuencia Patrimonial-Econ√≥mica de la Unidad Org√°nica de Polic√≠a Judicial de Le√≥n. Los detenidos fueron puestos a disposici√≥n de los Juzgados de Instrucci√≥n de La Ba√±eza (Le√≥n).
